Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Backend class for accessing and manipulating raw_inventory table values

  • Method Details

    • getInventoryCount

      public static int getInventoryCount(int inventoryID)
      Given an ID of an inventory item, returns its corresponding quantity value
      Parameters:
      inventoryID - rawitemid for inventory item of interest
      Returns:
      quantity value corresponding to inventoryID

    • getInventoryName

      public static String getInventoryName(int inventoryID)
      Given an ID of an inventory item, returns its corresponding name value
      Parameters:
      inventoryID - rawitemid for inventory item of interest
      Returns:
      name value corresponding to inventoryID

    • getAllInventoryNames

      public static Vector<String> getAllInventoryNames()
      Returns vector of strings containing all name values in raw_inventory table
      Returns:
      vector of name values in raw_inventory table

    • getNextInventoryID

      public static int getNextInventoryID()
      Returns the next available rawitemid and is used for adding inventory entries
      Returns:
      next available rawitemid value

    • AddInventoryItem

      public static void AddInventoryItem(String itemName, int Quant, int Minimum)
      Given a name, quantity, and minimum, add a new entry to the raw_inventory table
      Parameters:
      itemName - name of inventory item to be added
      Quant - quantity value of inventory item to be added
      Minimum - min value of inventory item to be added

    • getNextJunctionID

      public static int getNextJunctionID()
      Returns the next available junctionid and is used for adding inventory and menu entries
      Returns:
      next available junctionid value

    • AddJunctionTable

      public static void AddJunctionTable(int menuItemID, int rawItemID)
      Given a menuItemID and rawItemID, add a new entry to the raw_inventory table
      Parameters:
      menuItemID - itemid of menu item to be mapped
      rawItemID - rawitemid of inventory item to be mapped

    • getRawInventory

      public static Vector<Integer> getRawInventory(int itemid)
      Given an ID of an menu item, returns all raw inventory items associated with it
      Parameters:
      itemid - itemid for menu item of interest
      Returns:
      vector containing rawitemid's of all inventory items used in given menu item

    • getInventoryMin

      public static int getInventoryMin(int inventoryID)
      Given an ID of an inventory item, returns its corresponding min value. This is the minimum value we want to keep in stock at all times.
      Parameters:
      inventoryID - rawitemid for inventory item of interest
      Returns:
      min value corresponding to inventoryID

    • addInventoryStock

      public static void addInventoryStock(int rawItemID, int addAmount)
      Given an ID of an inventory item and an amount to add, increment the quantity value
      Parameters:
      rawItemID - rawitemid for inventory item of interest
      addAmount - amount to increment quantity value by

    • subtractInventoryStock

      public static void subtractInventoryStock(int rawItemID, int subAmount)
      Given an ID of an inventory item and an amount to subtract, decrement the quantity value
      Parameters:
      rawItemID - rawitemid for inventory item of interest
      subAmount - amount to decrement quantity value by

    • getOrderIDRange

      public static int[] getOrderIDRange(String startDate, String endDate)
      Given a start and end date, return the range of order ids during that period. This is used to calculate inventory product usage.
      Parameters:
      startDate - starting date for range of interest in yyyy-mm-dd format
      endDate - ending date for range of interest in yyyy-mm-dd format
      Returns:
      int array of size 2 with index 0 being min and 1 being max order id. null if no orders placed in range

    • countMenuItemsBetweenOrderIDs

      public static Vector<Integer> countMenuItemsBetweenOrderIDs(int minOrderID, int maxOrderID)
      Given a min and max order id, count number of times each menu item was ordered in that range. This is used to calculate inventory product usage.
      Parameters:
      minOrderID - minimum order id to include in range
      maxOrderID - maximum order id to include in range
      Returns:
      vector of ints with size equal to number of total menu items. each index corresonds to the menu item id and the value held is the number of times ordered in the orderid range

    • calculateInventoryUsage

      public static Vector<Integer> calculateInventoryUsage(Vector<Integer> menuItemCounts)
      Given a vector of ints corresponding to amount of each menu item ordered, determine the inventory usage for each inventory item.
      Parameters:
      menuItemCounts - vector of ints where each index corresonds to the menu item id and the value held is the number of times ordered.
      Returns:
      vector of ints with size equal to number of total inventory items. each index corresonds to the rawitemid and the value held is the number of units used to fulfill orders

    • scaleInventoryUsage

      public static Vector<Integer> scaleInventoryUsage(Vector<Integer> inventoryUsage)
      Given a vector of ints corresponding to amount of times each inventory item was used in an order, scale to the real amount of product used. This is called in calculateInventoryUsage to scale values before returning
      Parameters:
      inventoryUsage - vector of ints where each index corresonds to the inventory item id and the value held is the number of times used in orders.
      Returns:
      vector of ints where each index corresonds to id and the value held is the number of units used to fulfill orders

    • makeInventoryChanges

      public static void makeInventoryChanges(Vector<Integer> inventoryUsageScaled)
      Given a vector of ints corresponding to scaled amount each inventory product used, makes the necessary changes to the inventory quantity values
      Parameters:
      inventoryUsageScaled - vector of ints where each index corresonds to the inventory item id and the value held is the scaled number of product used.

    • generateProductUsage

      public static Vector<Vector<String>> generateProductUsage(String startDate, String endDate)
      Given a start and end date, calculates the scaled amount used for each inventory item. used to generate a product usage chart for the given date range.
      Parameters:
      startDate - starting date for range of interest in yyyy-mm-dd format
      endDate - ending date for range of interest in yyyy-mm-dd format
      Returns:
      vector of string vectors where inner vectors are vector of strings with ind 0 being inventory item name and ind 1 being scaled amount used

    • underMin

      public static Vector<String> underMin()
      Function that returns a formatted string for each inventory item below with quantity value below min value
      Returns:
      Vector of strings, with each string formatted with all relevant information to that inventory item. String format is "[name] ([rawitemid]) has a quantity of [quantity], which is below the [min] unit minimum value"

    • todaysInventoryUsage

      public static Vector<Integer> todaysInventoryUsage()
      Determine the scaled inventory usage for each inventory item in the current day of operation.
      Returns:
      vector of ints with size equal to number of total inventory items. each index corresonds to the rawitemid and the value held is the number of units used to fulfill orders

    • restockReport

      public static Vector<String> restockReport()
      Function that handles necessary inventory changes in the database for the current day of operation and returns a vector of formatted strings for all inventory items with quantity value below min value
      Returns:
      Vector of strings, with each string formatted with all relevant information to that inventory item. String format is "[name] ([rawitemid]) has a quantity of [quantity], which is below the [min] unit minimum value"
